name: polygonatum-pubescens
country-or-region-of-origin: Eastern Canada, central and eastern U.S.A.
light: Deep shade (Less than 2 hours to no direct sunlight)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: Blue-black berry 1/4" diameter that becomes available August-October.
flower-description: 1-3 bell-shaped stalked yellow-green flower 1/2" long come from leaf axils.  6 flaring lobes hide the stamens.  Flowers are difficult to see under leaves. Flowers bloom April-June.
leaf-description: Simple, narrow, lanceolate-elliptic 2"-5" long and 1"-2" wide.  Entire margins, pointed or blunt at the tip.  Upper side is hairless with parallel veins underside hairy.
stem-description: Erect at the bottom but arches under the weight of leaves toward teh top. Unbranched, zig-zag form, almost hairless.
